name: Town Hall Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed for 3 days in July with our 3 children and had an amazing experience. The hotel was easy to find. Check in was smooth and the 2 bedroom apartment was immaculate. The staff certainly went the extra-mile. There was a rubber ducky in the tub, chocolate truffles at bedtime, milk in the fridge for tea and coffee and an xbox to borrow one evening so my husband and I could enjoy the cocktail bar. Victoria park nearby is great for running and the staff recommended an excellent nearby pub for pizza and ice-cream. The pool was an added bonus for the kids and my husband thought the gym was very well equipped. I have never been moved to write a review before but this place deserves it. We have already made several recommendations to friends planning trips and hope to visit again soon.
reviews.title: Amazing oasis in the city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I love this neighborhood. Period. End of story. Great markets, great shopping, great pubs. Its London's equivalent of Williamsburg or Silverlake. A great mix of old & new.
reviews.title: East End ... I love you

reviews.text: This hotel is a crown jewel to the neighborhood. Its truly, the old Town Hall, beautifully converted into an amazing boutique hotel. The place even has a Michelin star restaurant in the lobby!
reviews.title: Why stay in a hotel when you can have an artistic apartment?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am not going to say which room I stayed in, because it was THE BEST room. I seriously considered , after my week long stay was over, claiming squatter rights or something.
reviews.title: Two Months + Exceptional Service = An Amazing Temporary Stay.

reviews.text: Oddly enough, even though this place is in the hippest part of London, the guest were not. Maybe because apartment style stays attack more families than anything. But that being said, I'm glad that this was the case.
reviews.title: Choose heaven, avoid the purgatory at all costs

reviews.text: Very nice and comfortable hotel, very fine old outside, comfortable new inside.
reviews.title: We followed the reviews and we liked it as many others

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All of the staff were very polite and friendly, the rooms are comfortable and very clean.
reviews.title: highly recommended hotel, great value for London

reviews.text: We had a room in the 3d floor with a good view to Eastend.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The area seemed safe and quite clean, it is a short walk to the tube station Bethnal Green (maybe 3 minutes), a bus station is nearly direct in front of the hotel.
reviews.title: Over our budget but worth every penny.

reviews.text: Shopping for all necessary items is nearby (some little shops).
reviews.title: Great place, dodgy area. Nice Food.

reviews.text: It could have been a mess, but it works. There's weirdo bric a brac from aspiring artists in the public areas, but my room that transformed into a studio apartment was slick and comfortable. The bistrot/breakfast room on the first floor dished up some yummy porridge with dried and fresh fruit in it. Oh, almost forgot to mention the bar. It has a NY style edginess. Didn't try Viajante, the restaurant that reviewers either hate or love
reviews.title: off the wall designer hotel; it works a treat

reviews.text: We loved the Town Hall. The building is spectacular and the rooms extremely spacious and comfortable. The pool is an unusual benefit for London. The restaurants are very pricey, but the food and drinks were excellent so we have no complaints. We'll definitely be back next time we're in London.
reviews.title: Absolutely beautiful and very comfortable

reviews.text: The hotel is lovely – very funky and luxurious – air con is not powerful enough and wifi sometimes is intermittent but overall very nice
reviews.title: Great hotel, lousy area

reviews.text: Gym and pool are also nice
reviews.title: excellent hotel experience

reviews.text: Issue is the area – very run down – in the middle of council estate (projects for those in the states) – which would be OK but the rooms are not that cheap (they are quite cheap for what you get though)
reviews.title: I'm sure we'll be back !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were attending a weekend festival in Victoria Park (about 15 minutes walk away) and decided to push the boat out by staying here for 3 nights. We travelled from Heathrow to Bethnal Green underground station, which is less than 5 minutes walk away.
reviews.title: Great boutique hotel in the East End

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed from 22 to 25/7/11 in Room LG01, which is locate on the lower ground floor (below street level but still a bright room) immediately opposite the swimming pool & gym.
reviews.title: This hotel was amazing

reviews.text: We were given a free upgrade from a double room to an executive studio, which costs considerably more. This gave us a fully equipped kitchen - dishwasher, washer/ dryer, microwave, fridge with icebox, espresso coffee machine, toaster, kettle, 4 ring ceramic hob and oven/ grill, salt and pepper. The kitchen hides away behind concertina doors. The hotel provided oven gloves, a teatowel, washingup cloth, washing up liquid, dishwasher and washing machine tablets and a hosy of cutlery, crockery, pots & pans and utensils. There was even two bottles of water and a pint of milk, which was replenished daily, in the fridge. The only things we didn't have were kitchen towel and placemats for the table.
reviews.title: The biggest surprise of my life, the best hotel I have ever stayed in!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room is also equipped with satellite TV, DVD player, Clock/ Radio/ Ipod dock, hair dryer, iron (but no board) and safe. The bathroom has towelling slippers and robes and lovely smelling toiletries. Many ofthe cupboards are hidden so you have to look for the washing machine and safe. Even the full length is a revolving shelf unit. There is a dinne table and chairs, as well as a sofa and coffee table. So plenty of room to sit and read, rtaher just llie on the bed.
reviews.title: great hotel in a nice, quite neighborhood

reviews.text: The pillows were a bit firm for my liking but that is an entirely personal thing. The king size bed was very comfortable.
reviews.title: Lovely apartment, highly recommended

aka: The Town Hall Hotel And Apartments
description: TOWN HALL HOTEL is a boutique hotel in the heart of London's East End. Offering luxury accommodations, event space and fine dining in an iconic Edwardian building.
